episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and intriguing topics, including NASA's use of inflatable owls to deter woodpeckers from damaging space shuttles, the unexpected financial success of a DVD anti-piracy ad composer, the unique Easter traditions in the Czech Republic, and the employment of a one-legged man to demonstrate the safety of the first escalator in London's Underground.

facts.fact: One of the last things that NASA had to do before launching space shuttles was detach the inflatable owls.
The famous anti-piracy advert music was used without proper compensation to the composer, who eventually received a settlement after a lengthy legal battle.
According to the government's website of the Czech Republic, there are three symbols of Easter in the Czech Republic: Easter eggs, the Easter lamb, and whipping.
At Earl's Court tube station in 1911, a one-legged man was employed to ride the escalator.
